00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the CN31XX, CN38XX, and CN58XX hardware DFA engine.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 95207 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 
00048 #ifndef __CVMX_DFA_H__
00049 #define __CVMX_DFA_H__
00050 #include "cvmx-llm.h"
00051 #include "cvmx-wqe.h"
00052 #include "cvmx-fpa.h"
00053 #include "cvmx-fau.h"
00054 
00055 #define ENABLE_DEPRECATED   /* Set to enable the old 18/36 bit names */
00056 
00057 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00058 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00059 extern "C" {
00060 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 /* Maximum nodes available in a small encoding */
00064 #define CVMX_DFA_NODESM_MAX_NODES       ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX)) ? 0x8000 : 0x20000)
00065 #define CVMX_DFA_NODESM_SIZE            512 /* Size of each node for small encoding */
00066 #define CVMX_DFA_NODELG_SIZE            1024    /* Size of each node for large encoding */
00067 #define CVMX_DFA_NODESM_LAST_TERMINAL  (CVMX_DFA_NODESM_MAX_NODES-1)
00068 
00069 #ifdef ENABLE_DEPRECATED
00070 /* These defines are for compatability with old code. They are deprecated */
00071 #define CVMX_DFA_NODE18_SIZE            CVMX_DFA_NODESM_SIZE
00072 #define CVMX_DFA_NODE36_SIZE            CVMX_DFA_NODELG_SIZE
00073 #define CVMX_DFA_NODE18_MAX_NODES       CVMX_DFA_NODESM_MAX_NODES
00074 #define CVMX_DFA_NODE18_LAST_TERMINAL   CVMX_DFA_NODESM_LAST_TERMINAL
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 extern CVMX_SHARED int cvmx_fau_dfa_state;
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Which type of memory encoding is this graph using. Make sure you setup
00081  * the LLM to match.
00082  */
00083 typedef enum {
00084     CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_SM = 0,
00085     CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_LG = 1,
00086 #ifdef ENABLE_DEPRECATED
00087     CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_18b = 0,    /* Deprecated */
00088     CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_36b = 1 /* Deprecated */
00089 #endif
00090 } cvmx_dfa_graph_type_t;
00091 
00092 /**
00093  * The possible node types.
00094  */
00095 typedef enum {
00096     CVMX_DFA_NODE_TYPE_NORMAL = 0,      /**< Node is a branch */
00097     CVMX_DFA_NODE_TYPE_MARKED = 1,      /**< Node is marked special */
00098     CVMX_DFA_NODE_TYPE_TERMINAL = 2     /**< Node is a terminal leaf */
00099 } cvmx_dfa_node_type_t;
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * The possible reasons the DFA stopped processing.
00103  */
00104 typedef enum {
00105     CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_DATA_GONE = 0,
00106                         /**< DFA ran out of data */
00107     CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_PARITY_ERROR = 1,
00108                         /**< DFA encountered a memory error */
00109     CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_FULL = 2,      /**< DFA is full */
00110     CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_TERMINAL = 3
00111                         /**< DFA hit a terminal */
00112 } cvmx_dfa_stop_reason_t;
00113 
00114 /**
00115  * This format describes the DFA pointers in small mode
00116  */
00117 typedef union {
00118     uint64_t u64;
00119     struct {
00120         uint64_t mbz:32;        /**< Must be zero */
00121         uint64_t p1:1;          /**< Set if next_node1 is odd parity */
00122         uint64_t next_node1:15;     /**< Next node if an odd character match */
00123         uint64_t p0:1;          /**< Set if next_node0 is odd parity */
00124         uint64_t next_node0:15;     /**< Next node if an even character match */
00125     } w32;
00126     struct {
00127         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00128         uint64_t p1:1;          /**< Set if next_node1 is odd parity */
00129         uint64_t next_node1:17;     /**< Next node if an odd character match */
00130         uint64_t p0:1;          /**< Set if next_node0 is odd parity */
00131         uint64_t next_node0:17;     /**< Next node if an even character match */
00132     } w36;
00133     struct {
00134 /**< @ this structure only applies starting in CN58XX and if DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 1 and IWORD0[NREPLEN] == 1.  */
00135         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00136         uint64_t p1:1;          /**< Set if next_node1 is odd parity */
00137         uint64_t per_node_repl1:1;      /**< enable for extra replicaiton for next node (CN58XX) */
00138         uint64_t next_node_repl1:2;     /**< extra replicaiton for next node (CN58XX) (if per_node_repl1 is set) */
00139         uint64_t next_node1:14;     /**< Next node if an odd character match - IWORD3[Msize], if per_node_repl1==1. */
00140         uint64_t p0:1;          /**< Set if next_node0 is odd parity */
00141         uint64_t per_node_repl0:1;      /**< enable for extra replicaiton for next node (CN58XX) */
00142         uint64_t next_node_repl0:2;     /**< extra replicaiton for next node (CN58XX) (if per_node_repl0 is set) */
00143         uint64_t next_node0:14;     /**< Next node if an odd character match - IWORD3[Msize], if per_node_repl0==1. */
00144     } w36nrepl_en;
00145            /**< use when next_node_repl[01] is 1. */
00146     struct {
00147 /**< this structure only applies starting in CN58XX and if DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 1 and IWORD0[NREPLEN] == 1.  */
00148         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00149         uint64_t p1:1;          /**< Set if next_node1 is odd parity */
00150         uint64_t per_node_repl1:1;      /**< enable for extra replicaiton for next node (CN58XX) */
00151         uint64_t next_node1:16;     /**< Next node if an odd character match, if per_node_repl1==0. */
00152         uint64_t p0:1;          /**< Set if next_node0 is odd parity */
00153         uint64_t per_node_repl0:1;      /**< enable for extra replicaiton for next node (CN58XX) */
00154         uint64_t next_node0:16;     /**< Next node if an odd character match, if per_node_repl0==0. */
00155     } w36nrepl_dis;
00156             /**< use when next_node_repl[01] is 0. */
00157 #if defined(ENABLE_DEPRECATED) && !OCTEON_IS_COMMON_BINARY()
00158 #if CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN31XX)
00159     struct {
00160 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00161         uint64_t mbz:32;        /**< Must be zero */
00162         uint64_t p1:1;          /**< Set if next_node1 is odd parity */
00163         uint64_t next_node1:15;     /**< Next node if an odd character match */
00164         uint64_t p0:1;          /**< Set if next_node0 is odd parity */
00165         uint64_t next_node0:15;     /**< Next node if an even character match */
00166     };
00167 #elif CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN38XX)
00168     struct {
00169 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00170         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00171         uint64_t p1:1;          /**< Set if next_node1 is odd parity */
00172         uint64_t next_node1:17;     /**< Next node if an odd character match */
00173         uint64_t p0:1;          /**< Set if next_node0 is odd parity */
00174         uint64_t next_node0:17;     /**< Next node if an even character match */
00175     };
00176 #else
00177     /* Other chips don't support the deprecated unnamed unions */
00178 #endif
00179 #endif
00180 } cvmx_dfa_node_next_sm_t;
00181 
00182 /**
00183  * This format describes the DFA pointers in large mode
00184  */
00185 typedef union {
00186     uint64_t u64;
00187     struct {
00188         uint64_t mbz:32;        /**< Must be zero */
00189         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00190         cvmx_dfa_node_type_t type:2;
00191                         /**< Node type */
00192         uint64_t mbz2:3;        /**< Must be zero */
00193         uint64_t next_node:20;      /**< Next node */
00194     } w32;
00195     struct {
00196         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00197         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00198         cvmx_dfa_node_type_t type:2;
00199                         /**< Node type */
00200         uint64_t extra_bits:5;         /**< bits copied to report (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero previously */
00201         uint64_t next_node_repl:2;     /**< extra replicaiton for next node (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero previously */
00202         uint64_t next_node:20;      /**< Next node ID,  Note, combine with next_node_repl to use as start_node
00203                                                      for continuation, as in cvmx_dfa_node_next_lgb_t. */
00204     } w36;
00205 #if defined(ENABLE_DEPRECATED) && !OCTEON_IS_COMMON_BINARY()
00206 #if CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN31XX)
00207     struct {
00208 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00209         uint64_t mbz:32;        /**< Must be zero */
00210         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00211         cvmx_dfa_node_type_t type:2;
00212                         /**< Node type */
00213         uint64_t mbz2:3;        /**< Must be zero */
00214         uint64_t next_node:20;      /**< Next node */
00215     };
00216 #elif CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN38XX)
00217     struct {
00218 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00219         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00220         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00221         cvmx_dfa_node_type_t type:2;
00222                         /**< Node type */
00223         uint64_t extra_bits:5;         /**< bits copied to report (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero previously */
00224         uint64_t next_node_repl:2;     /**< extra replicaiton for next node (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero previously */
00225         uint64_t next_node:20;      /**< Next node ID,  Note, combine with next_node_repl to use as start_node
00226                                                      for continuation, as in cvmx_dfa_node_next_lgb_t. */
00227     };
00228 #else
00229     /* Other chips don't support the deprecated unnamed unions */
00230 #endif
00231 #endif
00232 } cvmx_dfa_node_next_lg_t;
00233 
00234 /**
00235  * This format describes the DFA pointers in large mode, another way
00236  */
00237 typedef union {
00238     uint64_t u64;
00239     struct {
00240         uint64_t mbz:32;        /**< Must be zero */
00241         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00242         uint64_t type_terminal:1;     /**< Node type */
00243         uint64_t type_marked:1;       /**< Node type */
00244         uint64_t mbz2:3;        /**< Must be zero */
00245         uint64_t next_node:20;      /**< Next node */
00246     } w32;
00247     struct {
00248         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00249         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00250         uint64_t type_terminal:1;     /**< Node type */
00251         uint64_t type_marked:1;       /**< Node type */
00252         uint64_t extra_bits:5;         /**< bits copied to report (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero previously */
00253         uint64_t next_node_id_and_repl:22;      /**< Next node ID (and repl for PASS3/CN58XX or repl=0 if not),
00254                                                                  use this as start node for continuation. */
00255     } w36;
00256 #if defined(ENABLE_DEPRECATED) && !OCTEON_IS_COMMON_BINARY()
00257 #if CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN31XX)
00258     struct {
00259 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00260         uint64_t mbz:32;        /**< Must be zero */
00261         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00262         uint64_t type_terminal:1;     /**< Node type */
00263         uint64_t type_marked:1;       /**< Node type */
00264         uint64_t mbz2:3;        /**< Must be zero */
00265         uint64_t next_node:20;      /**< Next node */
00266     };
00267 #elif CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN38XX)
00268     struct {
00269 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00270         uint64_t mbz:28;        /**< Must be zero */
00271         uint64_t ecc:7;         /**< ECC checksum on the rest of the bits */
00272         uint64_t type_terminal:1;     /**< Node type */
00273         uint64_t type_marked:1;       /**< Node type */
00274         uint64_t extra_bits:5;         /**< bits copied to report (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero previously */
00275         uint64_t next_node_id_and_repl:22;      /**< Next node ID (and repl for PASS3/CN58XX or repl=0 if not),
00276                                                                  use this as start node for continuation. */
00277     };
00278 #else
00279     /* Other chips don't support the deprecated unnamed unions */
00280 #endif
00281 #endif
00282 } cvmx_dfa_node_next_lgb_t;
00283 
00284 /**
00285  * This format describes the DFA pointers in large mode
00286  */
00287 typedef union {
00288     uint64_t u64;
00289     struct {
00290         uint64_t mbz:27;        /**< Must be zero */
00291         uint64_t x0:1;          /**< XOR of the rest of the bits */
00292         uint64_t reserved:4;        /**< Must be zero */
00293         uint64_t data:32;       /**< LLM Data */
00294     } w32;
00295     struct {
00296         uint64_t mbz:27;        /**< Must be zero */
00297         uint64_t x0:1;          /**< XOR of the rest of the bits */
00298         uint64_t data:36;       /**< LLM Data */
00299     } w36;
00300 #if defined(ENABLE_DEPRECATED) && !OCTEON_IS_COMMON_BINARY()
00301 #if CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN31XX)
00302     struct {
00303 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00304         uint64_t mbz:27;        /**< Must be zero */
00305         uint64_t x0:1;          /**< XOR of the rest of the bits */
00306         uint64_t reserved:4;        /**< Must be zero */
00307         uint64_t data:32;       /**< LLM Data */
00308     };
00309 #elif CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN38XX)
00310     struct {
00311 /**< @deprecated unnamed reference to members */
00312         uint64_t mbz:27;        /**< Must be zero */
00313         uint64_t x0:1;          /**< XOR of the rest of the bits */
00314         uint64_t data:36;       /**< LLM Data */
00315     };
00316 #else
00317     /* Other chips don't support the deprecated unnamed unions */
00318 #endif
00319 #endif
00320 } cvmx_dfa_node_next_read_t;
00321 
00322 /**
00323  * This structure defines the data format in the low-latency memory
00324  */
00325 typedef union {
00326     uint64_t u64;
00327     cvmx_dfa_node_next_sm_t sm;
00328                     /**< This format describes the DFA pointers in small mode */
00329     cvmx_dfa_node_next_lg_t lg;
00330                     /**< This format describes the DFA pointers in large mode */
00331     cvmx_dfa_node_next_lgb_t lgb;
00332                     /**< This format describes the DFA pointers in large mode, another way */
00333     cvmx_dfa_node_next_read_t read;
00334                     /**< This format describes the DFA pointers in large mode */
00335 #ifdef ENABLE_DEPRECATED
00336     cvmx_dfa_node_next_sm_t s18;
00337                     /**< Deprecated */
00338     cvmx_dfa_node_next_lg_t s36;
00339                     /**< Deprecated */
00340     cvmx_dfa_node_next_lgb_t s36b;
00341                     /**< Deprecated */
00342 #endif
00343 } cvmx_dfa_node_next_t;
00344 
00345 /**
00346  * These structures define a DFA instruction
00347  */
00348 typedef union {
00349     uint64_t u64[4];
00350     uint32_t u32;
00351     struct {
00352         // WORD 0
00353         uint64_t gxor:8;           /**< Graph XOR value (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00354                                                      or if DFA_CFG[GXOR_ENA] == 0.  */
00355         uint64_t nxoren:1;         /**< Node XOR enable (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00356                                                      or if DFA_CFG[NXOR_ENA] == 0.  */
00357         uint64_t nreplen:1;        /**< Node Replication mode enable (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00358                                                      or if DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 0 or IWORD0[Ty] == 0.  */
00359 #if 0
00360         uint64_t snrepl:2;         /**< Start_Node Replication (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00361                                                      or if DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 0 or IWORD0[Ty] == 0 or IWORD0[NREPLEN] == 0.  */
00362         uint64_t start_node_id:20;
00363                         /**< Node to start the walk from */
00364 #else
00365         uint64_t start_node:22;     /**< Node to start the walk from, includes ID and snrepl, see notes above. */
00366 #endif
00367 
00368         uint64_t unused02:2;        /**< Must be zero */
00369         cvmx_llm_replication_t replication:2;
00370                         /**< Type of memory replication to use */
00371         uint64_t unused03:3;        /**< Must be zero */
00372         cvmx_dfa_graph_type_t type:1;
00373                         /**< Type of graph */
00374         uint64_t unused04:4;        /**< Must be zero */
00375         uint64_t base:20;       /**< All tables start on 1KB boundary */
00376 
00377         // WORD 1
00378         uint64_t input_length:16;
00379                         /**< In bytes, # pointers in gather case */
00380         uint64_t use_gather:1;      /**< Set to use gather */
00381         uint64_t no_L2_alloc:1;     /**< Set to disable loading of the L2 cache by the DFA */
00382         uint64_t full_block_write:1;
00383                         /**< If set, HW can write entire cache blocks @ result_ptr */
00384         uint64_t little_endian:1;
00385                         /**< Affects only packet data, not instruction, gather list, or result */
00386         uint64_t unused1:8;     /**< Must be zero */
00387         uint64_t data_ptr:36;       /**< Either directly points to data or the gather list. If gather list,
00388                                                     data_ptr<2:0> must be zero (i.e. 8B aligned) */
00389         // WORD 2
00390         uint64_t max_results:16;    /**< in 64-bit quantities, mbz for store */
00391         uint64_t unused2:12;        /**< Must be zero */
00392         uint64_t result_ptr:36;     /**< must be 128 byte aligned */
00393 
00394         // WORD 3
00395         uint64_t tsize:8;       /**< tsize*256 is the number of terminal nodes for GRAPH_TYPE_SM */
00396         uint64_t msize:16;      /**< msize is the number of marked nodes for GRAPH_TYPE_SM */
00397         uint64_t unused3:4;     /**< Must be zero */
00398         uint64_t wq_ptr:36;     /**< 0 for no work queue entry creation */
00399     } s;
00400 } cvmx_dfa_command_t;
00401 
00402 /**
00403  * Format of the first result word written by the hardware.
00404  */
00405 typedef union {
00406     uint64_t u64;
00407     struct {
00408         cvmx_dfa_stop_reason_t reas:2;
00409                         /**< Reason the DFA stopped */
00410         uint64_t mbz:44;        /**< Zero */
00411         uint64_t last_marked:1;     /**< Set if the last entry written is marked */
00412         uint64_t done:1;        /**< Set to 1 when the DFA completes */
00413         uint64_t num_entries:16;    /**< Number of result words written */
00414     } s;
00415 } cvmx_dfa_result0_t;
00416 
00417 /**
00418  * Format of the second result word and subsequent result words written by the hardware.
00419  */
00420 typedef union {
00421     uint64_t u64;
00422     struct {
00423         uint64_t byte_offset:16;
00424                     /**< Number of bytes consumed */
00425         uint64_t extra_bits_high:4;
00426                     /**< If PASS3 or CN58XX and DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 1 and IWORD0[Ty] == 1,
00427                                              then set to <27:24> of the last next-node pointer. Else set to 0x0.  */
00428         uint64_t prev_node:20;
00429                     /**< Index of the previous node */
00430         uint64_t extra_bits_low:2;
00431                     /**< If PASS3 or CN58XX and DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 1 and IWORD0[Ty] == 1,
00432                                              then set to <23:22> of the last next-node pointer. Else set to 0x0.  */
00433         uint64_t next_node_repl:2;
00434                     /**< If PASS3 or CN58XX and DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 1 and IWORD0[Ty] == 1, then set
00435                                              to next_node_repl (<21:20>) of the last next-node pointer. Else set to 0x0.  */
00436         uint64_t current_node:20;
00437                     /**< Index of the current node */
00438     } s;
00439     struct {
00440         uint64_t byte_offset:16;
00441                     /**< Number of bytes consumed */
00442         uint64_t extra_bits_high:4;
00443                     /**< If PASS3 or CN58XX and DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 1 and IWORD0[Ty] == 1,
00444                                              then set to <27:24> of the last next-node pointer. Else set to 0x0.  */
00445         uint64_t prev_node:20;
00446                     /**< Index of the previous node */
00447         uint64_t extra_bits_low:2;
00448                     /**< If PASS3 or CN58XX and DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 1 and IWORD0[Ty] == 1,
00449                                              then set to <23:22> of the last next-node pointer. Else set to 0x0.  */
00450         uint64_t curr_id_and_repl:22;
00451                     /**< Use ths as start_node for continuation. */
00452     } s2;
00453 } cvmx_dfa_result1_t;
00454 
00455 /**
00456  * Abstract DFA graph
00457  */
00458 typedef struct {
00459     cvmx_llm_replication_t replication;     /**< Level of memory replication to use. Must match the LLM setup */
00460     cvmx_dfa_graph_type_t type;         /**< Type of graph */
00461     uint64_t base_address;              /**< LLM start address of the graph */
00462     union {
00463         struct {
00464             uint64_t gxor:8;        /**< Graph XOR value (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00465                                                           or if DFA_CFG[GXOR_ENA] == 0.  */
00466             uint64_t nxoren:1;      /**< Node XOR enable (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00467                                                           or if DFA_CFG[NXOR_ENA] == 0.  */
00468             uint64_t nreplen:1;     /**< Node Replication mode enable (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00469                                                           or if DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 0 or IWORD0[Ty] == 0.  */
00470             uint64_t snrepl:2;      /**< Start_Node Replication (PASS3/CN58XX), Must be zero for other chips
00471                                                           or if DFA_CFG[NRPL_ENA] == 0 or IWORD0[Ty] == 0 or IWORD0[NREPLEN] == 0.*/
00472             uint64_t start_node_id:20;
00473                             /**< Start node index for the root of the graph */
00474         };
00475         uint32_t start_node;            /**< Start node index for the root of the graph, incl. snrepl (PASS3/CN58XX)
00476                                                            NOTE: for backwards compatibility this name includes the the
00477                                                                  gxor, nxoren, nreplen, and snrepl fields which will all be
00478                                                                  zero in applicaitons existing before the introduction of these
00479                                                                  fields, so that existing applicaiton do not need to change. */
00480     };
00481     int num_terminal_nodes;             /**< Number of terminal nodes in the graph. Only needed for small graphs. */
00482     int num_marked_nodes;               /**< Number of marked nodes in the graph. Only needed for small graphs. */
00483 } cvmx_dfa_graph_t;
00484 
00485 /**
00486  * DFA internal global state -- stored in 8 bytes of FAU
00487  */
00488 typedef union {
00489     uint64_t u64;
00490     struct {
00491 #define CVMX_DFA_STATE_TICKET_BIT_POS 16
00492 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00493         // NOTE:  must clear LSB of base_address_div16 due to ticket overflow
00494         uint32_t base_address_div16;         /**< Current DFA instruction queue chunck base address/16 (clear LSB). */
00495         uint8_t ticket_loops;            /**< bits [15:8] of total number of tickets requested. */
00496         uint8_t ticket;              /**< bits [7:0] of total number of tickets requested (current ticket held). */
00497         // NOTE: index and now_serving are written together
00498         uint8_t now_serving;             /**< current ticket being served (or ready to be served). */
00499         uint8_t index;               /**< index into current chunk: (base_address_div16*16)[index] = next entry. */
00500 #else               // NOTE: little endian mode probably won't work
00501         uint8_t index;
00502         uint8_t now_serving;
00503         uint8_t ticket;
00504         uint8_t ticket_loops;
00505         uint32_t base_address_div16;
00506 #endif
00507     } s;
00508     struct {        // a bitfield version of the same thing to extract base address while clearing carry.
00509 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00510         uint64_t base_address_div32:31;         /**< Current DFA instruction queue chunck base address/32. */
00511         uint64_t carry:1;               /**< Carry out from total_tickets. */
00512         uint64_t total_tickets:16;          /**< Total tickets. */
00513         uint64_t now_serving:8;             /**< current ticket being served (or ready to be served). */
00514         uint64_t index:8;               /**< index into current chunk. */
00515 #else               // NOTE: little endian mode probably won't work
00516         uint64_t index:8;
00517         uint64_t now_serving:8;
00518         uint64_t total_tickets:16;
00519         uint64_t carry:1;
00520         uint64_t base_address_div32:31;
00521 #endif
00522     } s2;
00523 } cvmx_dfa_state_t;
00524 
00525 /**
00526  * Sets up the DFA configuration data
00527  * (Only FPA pool for now)
00528  */
00529 typedef struct
00530 {
00531     cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t dfa_pool;
00532 }cvmx_dfa_app_config_t;
00533 
00534 extern CVMX_SHARED cvmx_dfa_app_config_t dfa_config;

00540 {

00566 void cvmx_dfa_set_fpa_pool_config(int64_t pool, uint64_t buffer_size,

00576 
00577 /**
00578  * Write a small node edge to LLM.
00579  *
00580  * @param graph  Graph to modify
00581  * @param source_node
00582  *               Source node for this edge
00583  * @param match_index
00584  *               Index into the node edge table. This is the match character/2.
00585  * @param destination_node0
00586  *               Destination if the character matches (match_index*2).
00587  * @param destination_node1
00588  *               Destination if the character matches (match_index*2+1).
00589  */
00590 static inline void cvmx_dfa_write_edge_sm(const cvmx_dfa_graph_t * graph, uint64_t source_node, uint64_t match_index, uint64_t destination_node0, uint64_t destination_node1)
00591 {
00592     cvmx_llm_address_t address;
00593     cvmx_dfa_node_next_t next_ptr;
00594 
00595     address.u64 = graph->base_address + source_node * CVMX_DFA_NODESM_SIZE + match_index * 4;
00596 
00597     next_ptr.u64 = 0;
00598     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX)) {
00599         next_ptr.sm.w32.next_node0 = destination_node0;
00600         next_ptr.sm.w32.p0 = cvmx_llm_parity(destination_node0);
00601 
00602         next_ptr.sm.w32.next_node1 = destination_node1;
00603         next_ptr.sm.w32.p1 = cvmx_llm_parity(destination_node1);
00604     } else {
00605         next_ptr.sm.w36.next_node0 = destination_node0;
00606         next_ptr.sm.w36.p0 = cvmx_llm_parity(destination_node0);
00607 
00608         next_ptr.sm.w36.next_node1 = destination_node1;
00609         next_ptr.sm.w36.p1 = cvmx_llm_parity(destination_node1);
00610     }
00611 
00612     cvmx_llm_write36(address, next_ptr.u64, 0);
00613 }
00614 
00615 #ifdef ENABLE_DEPRECATED
00616 #define cvmx_dfa_write_edge18 cvmx_dfa_write_edge_sm
00617 #endif
00618 
00619 /**
00620  * Write a large node edge to LLM.
00621  *
00622  * @param graph  Graph to modify
00623  * @param source_node
00624  *               Source node for this edge
00625  * @param match  Character to match before taking this edge.
00626  * @param destination_node
00627  *               Destination node of the edge.
00628  * @param destination_type
00629  *               Node type at the end of this edge.
00630  */
00631 static inline void cvmx_dfa_write_node_lg(const cvmx_dfa_graph_t * graph,
00632                       uint64_t source_node, unsigned char match, uint64_t destination_node, cvmx_dfa_node_type_t destination_type)
00633 {
00634     cvmx_llm_address_t address;
00635     cvmx_dfa_node_next_t next_ptr;
00636 
00637     address.u64 = graph->base_address + source_node * CVMX_DFA_NODELG_SIZE + (uint64_t) match *4;
00638 
00639     next_ptr.u64 = 0;
00640     if (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX)) {
00641         next_ptr.lg.w32.type = destination_type;
00642         next_ptr.lg.w32.next_node = destination_node;
00643         next_ptr.lg.w32.ecc = cvmx_llm_ecc(next_ptr.u64);
00644     } else {
00645         next_ptr.lg.w36.type = destination_type;
00646         next_ptr.lg.w36.next_node = destination_node;
00647         next_ptr.lg.w36.ecc = cvmx_llm_ecc(next_ptr.u64);
00648     }
00649 
00650     cvmx_llm_write36(address, next_ptr.u64, 0);
00651 }
00652 
00653 #ifdef ENABLE_DEPRECATED
00654 #define cvmx_dfa_write_node36 cvmx_dfa_write_node_lg
00655 #endif
00656 
00657 /**
00658  * Ring the DFA doorbell telling it that new commands are
00659  * available.
00660  *
00661  * @param num_commands
00662  *               Number of new commands
00663  */
00664 static inline void cvmx_dfa_write_doorbell(uint64_t num_commands)
00665 {
00666     CVMX_SYNCWS;
00667     cvmx_write_csr(CVMX_DFA_DBELL, num_commands);
00668 }
00669 
00670 /**
00671  * @INTERNAL
00672  * Write a new command to the DFA. Calls to this function
00673  * are internally synchronized across all processors, and
00674  * the doorbell is rung during this function.
00675  *
00676  * @param command Command to write
00677  */
00678 
00679 static inline void __cvmx_dfa_write_command(cvmx_dfa_command_t * command)
00680 {
00681     cvmx_dfa_state_t cvmx_dfa_state;
00682     uint64_t my_ticket; // needs to wrap to 8 bits
00683     uint64_t index;
00684     cvmx_dfa_command_t *head;
00685 
00686     CVMX_PREFETCH0(command);
00687     // take a ticket.
00688     cvmx_dfa_state.u64 = cvmx_fau_fetch_and_add64(cvmx_fau_dfa_state, 1ull << CVMX_DFA_STATE_TICKET_BIT_POS);
00689     my_ticket = cvmx_dfa_state.s.ticket;
00690 
00691     // see if it is our turn
00692     while (my_ticket != cvmx_dfa_state.s.now_serving) {
00693         int delta = my_ticket - cvmx_dfa_state.s.now_serving;
00694         if (delta < 0)
00695             delta += 256;
00696         cvmx_wait(10 * delta);  // reduce polling load on system
00697         cvmx_dfa_state.u64 = cvmx_fau_fetch_and_add64(cvmx_fau_dfa_state, 0);   // poll for my_ticket==now_serving
00698     }
00699 
00700     // compute index and instruction queue head pointer
00701     index = cvmx_dfa_state.s.index;
00702 
00703     // NOTE: the DFA only supports 36-bit addressing
00704     head = &((CASTPTR(cvmx_dfa_command_t, (cvmx_dfa_state.s2.base_address_div32 * 32ull))[index]));
00705     head = (cvmx_dfa_command_t *) cvmx_phys_to_ptr(CAST64(head));   // NOTE: since we are not storing bit 63 of address, we must set it now
00706 
00707     // copy the command to the instruction queue
00708     *head++ = *command;
00709 
00710     // check if a new chunk is needed
00711     if (cvmx_unlikely((++index >= ((cvmx_fpa_get_dfa_pool_block_size() - 8) /                           sizeof(cvmx_dfa_command_t))))) {
00712         uint64_t *new_base = (uint64_t *) cvmx_fpa_alloc(cvmx_fpa_get_dfa_pool());  // could make this async
00713         if (new_base) {
00714             // put the link into the instruction queue's "Next Chunk Buffer Ptr"
00715             *(uint64_t *) head = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(new_base);
00716             // update our state (note 32-bit write to not disturb other fields)
00717             cvmx_fau_atomic_write32((cvmx_fau_reg32_t) (cvmx_fau_dfa_state + (CAST64(&cvmx_dfa_state.s.base_address_div16) - CAST64(&cvmx_dfa_state))),
00718                         (CAST64(new_base)) / 16);
00719         } else {
00720             cvmx_dprintf("__cvmx_dfa_write_command: Out of memory. Expect crashes.\n");
00721         }
00722         index = 0;
00723     }
00724 
00725     cvmx_dfa_write_doorbell(1);
00726 
00727     // update index and now_serving in the DFA state FAU location (NOTE: this write16 updates to 8-bit values.)
00728     // NOTE: my_ticket+1 carry out is lost due to write16 and index has already been wrapped to fit in uint8.
00729     cvmx_fau_atomic_write16((cvmx_fau_reg16_t) (cvmx_fau_dfa_state + (CAST64(&cvmx_dfa_state.s.now_serving) - CAST64(&cvmx_dfa_state))), ((my_ticket + 1) << 8) | index);
00730 }
00731 
00732 /**
00733  * Submit work to the DFA units for processing
00734  *
00735  * @param graph   Graph to process
00736  * @param start_node
00737  *                The node to start (or continue) walking from
00738  *                includes. start_node_id and snrepl (PASS3/CN58XX), but gxor,
00739  *                nxoren, and nreplen are taken from the graph structure
00740  * @param input   The input to match against
00741  * @param input_length
00742  *                The length of the input in bytes
00743  * @param use_gather
00744  *        The input and input_length are of a gather list
00745  * @param is_little_endian
00746  *                Set to 1 if the input is in little endian format and must
00747  *                be swapped before compare.
00748  * @param result  Location the DFA should put the results in. This must be
00749  *                an area sized in multiples of a cache line.
00750  * @param max_results
00751  *                The maximum number of 64-bit result1 words after result0.
00752  *                That is, "size of the result area in 64-bit words" - 1.
00753  *                max_results must be at least 1.
00754  * @param work    Work queue entry to submit when DFA completes. Can be NULL.
00755  */
00756 static inline void cvmx_dfa_submit(const cvmx_dfa_graph_t * graph, int start_node,
00757                    void *input, int input_length, int use_gather, int is_little_endian, cvmx_dfa_result0_t * result, int max_results, cvmx_wqe_t * work)
00758 {
00759     cvmx_dfa_command_t command;
00760 
00761     /* Make sure the result's first 64bit word is zero so we can tell when the
00762        DFA is done. */
00763     result->u64 = 0;
00764 
00765     // WORD 0
00766     command.u64[0] = 0;
00767     command.s.gxor = graph->gxor;   // (PASS3/CN58XX)
00768     command.s.nxoren = graph->nxoren;   // (PASS3/CN58XX)
00769     command.s.nreplen = graph->nreplen; // (PASS3/CN58XX)
00770     command.s.start_node = start_node;  // includes snrepl (PASS3/CN58XX)
00771     command.s.replication = graph->replication;
00772     command.s.type = graph->type;
00773     command.s.base = graph->base_address >> 10;
00774 
00775     // WORD 1
00776     command.u64[1] = 0;
00777     command.s.input_length = input_length;
00778     command.s.use_gather = use_gather;
00779     command.s.no_L2_alloc = 0;
00780     command.s.full_block_write = 1;
00781     command.s.little_endian = is_little_endian;
00782     command.s.data_ptr = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(input);
00783 
00784     // WORD 2
00785     command.u64[2] = 0;
00786     command.s.max_results = max_results;
00787     command.s.result_ptr = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(result);
00788 
00789     // WORD 3
00790     command.u64[3] = 0;
00791     if (graph->type == CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_SM) {
00792         command.s.tsize = (graph->num_terminal_nodes + 255) / 256;
00793         command.s.msize = graph->num_marked_nodes;
00794     }
00795     command.s.wq_ptr = cvmx_ptr_to_phys(work);
00796 
00797     __cvmx_dfa_write_command(&command); // NOTE: this does synchronization and rings doorbell
00798 }
00799 
00800 /**
00801  * DFA gather list element
00802  */
00803 typedef struct {
00804     uint64_t length:16;     /**< length of piece of data at addr */
00805     uint64_t reserved:12;
00806                     /**< reserved, set to 0 */
00807     uint64_t addr:36;       /**< pointer to piece of data */
00808 } cvmx_dfa_gather_entry_t;
00809 
00810 /**
00811  * Check if a DFA has completed processing
00812  *
00813  * @param result_ptr Result area the DFA is using
00814  * @return Non zero if the DFA is done
00815  */
00816 static inline uint64_t cvmx_dfa_is_done(cvmx_dfa_result0_t * result_ptr)
00817 {
00818     /* DFA sets the first result 64bit word to non zero when it's done */
00819     return ((volatile cvmx_dfa_result0_t *)result_ptr)->s.done;
00820 }
00821 
00822 /**
00823  * Initialize the DFA hardware before use
00824  * Returns 0 on success, -1 on failure
00825  */
00826 int cvmx_dfa_initialize(void);
00827 
00828 /**
00829  * Shutdown and cleanup resources used by the DFA
00830  */
00831 void cvmx_dfa_shutdown(void);
